text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Reasons for mass poisoning of ethnic Albanian children in the Tetovo region last autumn still unknow. World Health Organiation has still not published results of its inquiry. Those responsible cannot count on time, comments paper.

- Two sets of employment statistics exist in Macedonia. According to one there are 340,729 unemployed and the other says 533,441. Which one can be believed? It seems many people work illegally and employers avoid paying taxes and social security.
- Macedonia to nominate three candidates for judges in the European Court for Human Rights within the Council of Europe -- Cvetko Cvetkovski, Vlado Kambovski and Gjorgij Marjanovic.
- New Skopje mayor Risto Penov engaged a special company to investigate city's financial situation. He says the reason is "not to see whether the previous mayor and his team made illegal profits".
